episodeTitle: Cause the Last Miracle - Breaking Through the Gate of Justice
episodeTitleJapanese: 起こせ最後の奇跡 正義の門を突破せよ
episodeTitleRomanized: Okose Saigo no Kiseki - Seigi no Mon o Toppaseyo
description: The Impel Down prisoners escape on a Marine ship guided by whale sharks, but the Gate of Justice blocks their path to freedom. Bentham makes the ultimate sacrifice, disguising himself as Magellan to open the gate, allowing Luffy and 241 prisoners to escape while facing certain capture himself.

events.title: Prisoners Escape Impel Down via Whale Sharks
events.description: The 241 escaped prisoners, including Luffy, Jinbe, Crocodile, Buggy, and Ivankov, successfully flee Impel Down prison aboard a captured Marine ship. They are transported by whale sharks that Jinbe summoned to aid their escape.
events.significance: Marks the successful mass breakout from the world's most secure prison, an unprecedented event in One Piece history that will have lasting consequences for the World Government's credibility.

events.title: Marine Warships Pursue Escapees
events.description: Multiple Marine warships pursue the escaped prisoners' vessel, firing cannonballs in an attempt to stop the breakout. The prisoners must navigate through the artillery barrage while heading toward the Gate of Justice.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Marines' determination to prevent the unprecedented prison break and sets up the critical obstacle that requires Bentham's sacrifice.

events.title: Gate of Justice Blocks Escape Route
events.description: The escaped prisoners arrive at the massive Gate of Justice, the final barrier between Impel Down and freedom. The gate remains closed, blocking their path to the open sea and toward Marineford where Ace awaits execution.
events.significance: Creates the critical obstacle that necessitates Bentham's heroic sacrifice. The Gate of Justice is a crucial World Government installation that controls access between the three pillars of Marine power.

events.title: Bentham Decides to Sacrifice Himself
events.description: Realizing that someone must stay behind to open the Gate of Justice from the control room, Bentham volunteers to sacrifice his freedom. He understands this means he will be left behind in Impel Down with no chance of escape, but does so willingly to save Luffy and the others.
events.significance: One of the most emotionally powerful moments in One Piece, showcasing Bentham's unwavering loyalty and selflessness. This decision cements his status as one of Luffy's most dedicated allies despite their brief time together.

quotes.text: Luffy-boy, make sure you save your brother!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bentham's final message to Luffy before confronting Magellan

events.title: Bentham Disguises as Magellan
events.description: Bentham uses his Mane Mane no Mi (Clone-Clone Fruit) powers to perfectly transform into Warden Magellan, allowing him to access the Gate of Justice control room. This deception is essential to operating the gate mechanism without raising immediate alarm.
events.significance: Demonstrates the critical utility of Bentham's Devil Fruit power in the most consequential moment. His ability to perfectly mimic anyone becomes the key to saving hundreds of lives.

events.title: Bentham Opens the Gate of Justice
events.description: Disguised as Magellan, Bentham successfully operates the control panel to open the massive Gate of Justice. He then destroys the mechanism to prevent it from being closed again, ensuring the prisoners can escape but also sealing his own fate.
events.significance: The pivotal action that saves 241 prisoners and allows Luffy to continue toward Marineford to save Ace. This selfless act represents the ultimate expression of friendship and sacrifice in One Piece.

events.title: Real Magellan Confronts Bentham
events.description: The real Warden Magellan arrives at the control room, shocked to find an imposter. Bentham drops his disguise and faces Magellan directly, knowing he cannot defeat the Warden but refusing to back down. Magellan, enraged by the deception and prison break, prepares to attack.
events.significance: Sets up what appears to be Bentham's final stand. Facing the most powerful figure in Impel Down alone represents the ultimate price of his sacrifice.

events.title: Bentham's Declaration of No Regrets
events.description: When Magellan asks Bentham for his final words before being killed, Bentham responds with pride and defiance, stating he has no regrets. Sobbing but resolute, he tells Luffy via Den Den Mushi to make sure he saves his brother Ace.
events.significance: Embodies the One Piece theme of living and dying without regrets while pursuing one's values. Bentham's courage in the face of certain death inspires both the characters and audience, making this one of the series' most memorable emotional moments.

events.title: Luffy and Prisoners' Emotional Farewell to Bentham
events.description: As the ship passes through the Gate of Justice, Luffy and the other prisoners witness Bentham's sacrifice. The prisoners cry out in gratitude and sorrow, while Luffy is visibly devastated by having to leave his friend behind. The moment is filled with tears from both the characters and typically from viewers.
events.significance: One of the most emotionally impactful scenes in One Piece. This farewell demonstrates the depth of bonds formed through shared struggle and highlights the cost of pursuing one's dreams. The prisoners' collective grief shows how Bentham's sacrifice touched everyone, not just Luffy.

events.title: Escape Ship Passes Through Gate of Justice
events.description: The captured Marine ship carrying 241 escaped prisoners successfully passes through the now-open Gate of Justice, heading toward Marineford and the impending war. Their successful escape from the world's most secure prison is now complete, though at the cost of Bentham's freedom.
events.significance: Completes the Impel Down escape arc and transitions toward the Marineford War arc. This unprecedented mass breakout will have major consequences for the World Government and sets up the next phase of Luffy's desperate attempt to save Ace.

themes.description: The episode's central theme is the ultimate sacrifice made out of friendship. Bentham willingly gives up his freedom and potentially his life to save Luffy and the other prisoners, asking for nothing in return.
themes.symbolism: The Gate of Justice serves as a symbolic barrier between freedom and imprisonment, but also represents the choice between selfish escape and selfless sacrifice. Bentham's destruction of the gate mechanism symbolizes burning bridges for the sake of others.

themes.description: Bentham's declaration of having no regrets embodies a core One Piece philosophy: living true to one's values and bonds is more important than survival. This theme resonates throughout the series with characters who choose meaningful death over empty survival.
themes.symbolism: Bentham facing Magellan alone represents standing by one's convictions even in the face of overwhelming odds.

themes.description: The episode explores how the bonds formed between Luffy and Bentham, despite their initial meeting as enemies, have become strong enough to inspire ultimate sacrifice. These bonds transcend original affiliations and allegiances.
themes.symbolism: The tears of 241 prisoners show how one person's sacrifice can touch an entire community.

characterSpotlights.development: Bentham completes his character arc from Baroque Works villain to selfless hero. His sacrifice demonstrates how his friendship with Luffy has fundamentally changed him, transforming him into someone willing to give up everything for his friend's dream.

characterSpotlights.development: Magellan's confrontation with Bentham shows his dedication to his role as Warden, even in the face of the prison's greatest failure. His rage represents the system's response to those who defy it.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the emotional farewell scene between Bentham and Luffy with additional reaction shots and prolonged crying sequences, while the manga handled it more briefly.
The anime added more action sequences showing the Marine warships firing cannonballs at the escape vessel, while the manga showed this more simply.

trivia.fact: This episode covers only one manga chapter (548), but extends the emotional moments significantly with animation, making Bentham's sacrifice even more impactful for anime viewers.
Bentham's sacrifice scene is consistently ranked as one of the most emotional moments in One Piece by fans, despite him not being a Straw Hat crew member.
Although this episode strongly implies Bentham's death, he later resurfaces alive in cover stories and becomes the new Queen of Newkama Land (Level 5.5) in Impel Down.
The Gate of Justice is one of three gates that form a triangle between Enies Lobby, Impel Down, and Marineford, allowing rapid Marine transit between these crucial World Government facilities.
